instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMBUS_BATT_SCL: What is SMBUS_BATT_SCL? SMBUS_BATT_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.SMBUS_BATT_SDA: What is SMBUS_BATT_SDA? SMBUS_BATT_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Battery showing X, but runs off battery
threads.message:
hey guys, 

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

Green light, no signs on liquid damage at all, green light, no orange, 

Computer runs off charger, and when battery is plugged in shows X, when i unplug the charger, it still shows X but it actually runs off the battery, so computer stays on, 

if battery plugged in and computer off, it DOES NOT come on until i plug charger again, 


- resistance between(<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>) 17/18 is 4.0 ohms and 27/28 is 20.9 ,  <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> 20.6 ohms



please help, and thank you guys in advance,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Battery showing X, but runs off battery
threads.message:
Exact voltage at F7040?
W/ and w/o battery connected; charger always connected, of course...

Voltage and resistance to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus?

Voltage pins 9 & 15 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

"17/18 is 4.0 ohms"
2.7 ohms sounds better; leads resistance included (2.2 w/o)...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Battery showing X, but runs off battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Battery showing X, but runs off battery
threads.message: John, I did try a new battery, and also tested with a separate exact same board, and all batteries are good, Thank you so much for your input,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Battery showing X, but runs off battery
threads.message:
I would look at pins 4 and 5 at the battery connector, it looks like a problem with those data lines and it can't detect the battery, It appears the charger and battery line tie together, so maybe when it can't
detect the battery it won't turn on, but once it is on, the battery power is bonded to the power so it will draw from there once the charger says DC is available. Also possibly <RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR>, which looks is the path for the battery to ground for it to detect it is connected to a computer, maybe if that isn't there it won't talk on 4/5. Just speculating from the schematic.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Battery showing X, but runs off battery
threads.message:
SMC likely to be dead.

what voltage on PPBUS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Battery showing X, but runs off battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Battery showing X, but runs off battery
threads.message:
F7040, 8.16V with and without battery, on both sides.

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_BATT_SCL</SIGNAL> - 3.39v

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_BATT_SDA</SIGNAL> - Bounces from 3.39 to 0.17v back to 3.39v and continues to do the same

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> PIN 9 -  0.22V    PIN 15 -  0.72V

 resistance between(<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>) 17/18 is 3.4 ohms this time :/

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Battery showing X, but runs off battery
threads.message:
Don't use comments please!

Either dead SMC or dead <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
